subject: Real Estate
title: Habitability: The Landlord's Duty
description: A 60-second lesson on Habitability: The Landlord's Duty.

hook.text: The heat is broken, mold is growing, and the landlord won't fix it. Do you still have to pay rent?

buildup.text: The implied warranty of habitability requires landlords to maintain safe and livable conditions.

discovery.text: If conditions are uninhabitable, tenants in many states can withhold rent, repair and deduct, or break the lease.

twist.text: The warranty doesn't cover cosmetic issues. Ugly wallpaper and stained carpet aren't habitability violations.

climax.text: Habitability protections ensure that paying rent entitles tenants to a home that meets basic standards.

punchline.text: A landlord must provide a home that's safe to live in.

quiz.question: What can tenants do if a landlord violates habitability standards?
